meanings.definition: A device on a camera that shows the field of view of the lens.
meanings.sent1: The photographer looked through the viewfinder to frame the perfect shot.
meanings.sent2: When taking a photo, make sure to look through the viewfinder to see what the camera sees.
meanings.sent3: The viewfinder on the camera made it easy for the photographer to capture the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a viewfinder, focusing on the details others often missed.
meanings.sent5: Using the viewfinder, he adjusted the composition until the image was just right.

meanings.definition: A small screen on a camcorder that displays what is being recorded.
meanings.sent1: The videographer checked the viewfinder to ensure the shot was in focus.
meanings.sent2: The viewfinder on the camcorder showed a live feed of the scene being filmed.
meanings.sent3: The viewfinder on the camcorder glitched, making everything look like a funhouse mirror.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a viewfinder, capturing memories with vivid clarity.
meanings.sent5: Through the viewfinder, he could see the world in a whole new way.
